intro: Lesquerella purpurea, commonly known as the purple lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces small, purple flowers and has hairy, glandular leaves that help it retain moisture. Its seeds contain a unique oil rich in erucic acid, which has been studied for industrial and potential medicinal uses. Lesquerella purpurea thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils.
